title: Molecular Biology
text:
This is my personal site for the course Molecular Biology.
I’m collecting my notes and exercises here as PDFs. They’re not meant to be perfect—just a record of my learning and a way to consolidate the material.




DNA & RNA structure and function

Bases and base-pairing; sugar-phosphate backbone; polarity (5′→3′); duplex thermodynamics; melting/renaturation; hybridization; common RNA secondary structures (hairpins, stems, bulges).

Central dogma

Information flow DNA → RNA → protein; where regulation acts.

DNA replication

Origins; helicase & primase; DNA polymerases; leading/lagging strands; Okazaki fragments; ligase; proofreading & fidelity.

Transcription — prokaryotes

RNAP holoenzyme & σ factor; promoters (−10/−35); initiation/elongation; termination (ρ-dependent/independent).

Transcription — eukaryotes

Pol I/II/III; promoters (TATA, Inr, CpG); general TFs & pre-initiation complex; enhancers/silencers, mediator; termination.

RNA processing

5′ capping; splicing (snRNPs), alternative splicing; 3′ polyadenylation; RNA stability & decay.

Translation

Genetic code; tRNA charging (aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases); ribosome structure; initiation/elongation/termination; wobble & accuracy.

Gene regulation — prokaryotes

Operons (lac, trp); repressors & activators; attenuation; small RNAs.

Gene regulation — eukaryotes

Chromatin structure & nucleosomes; histone modifications; chromatin remodeling; DNA methylation; TFs & cofactors; enhancers, insulators, looping.

Mutations & DNA repair

Point mutations & indels; mismatch repair; base- and nucleotide-excision repair; double-strand break repair (HR/NHEJ); transposition.

Horizontal gene transfer

Transformation, transduction, conjugation; plasmids & phage; mobile genetic elements.

Core molecular methods

PCR/qPCR/RT-PCR; restriction enzymes & ligation; Gibson assembly; gel electrophoresis; Sanger sequencing; NGS basics (libraries, coverage, QC).

Recombinant DNA & expression systems

Vectors (bacterial/yeast/mammalian); selectable markers; tags & purification; inducible promoters; expression optimization.

Applications & ethics (brief)

CRISPR/Cas basics; diagnostics & biotechnology; biosafety and ethical considerations.
